title: Open source etiquette
summary: If you've not worked on an open source project (OSP) before, it is a good idea to read this article before starting to contribute to MDN Web Docs (or other open source projects). There are a few best practices to adopt that will help ensure that you and the other project contributors feel valued and safe, and stay productive.
pageTitle: Open source etiquette - The MDN Web Docs project | MDN
